RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Possui graduao em Engenharia Mecnica Aeronutica pelo Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1986), MBA em planejamento estratgico pela USP (2000), mestrado em Engenharia de Sistemas Logsticos pela Escola Politcnica, USP (2006) e doutorado em Engenharia de transportes pela Escola Politcnica da USP (2014). J atuou como gerente ou diretor executivo em diversas empresas, tais como, Ericsson, Promon , grupo Unigel, Monsanto, Redecard e como presidente na Volex do Brasil, multinacional britnica do ramo de eletroeletrnicos. Atualmente professor de ps-graduao e scio diretor da Teclog. Tem a certificao CPIM da APICS (2001) e fala fluentemente os idiomas ingls, espanhol e italiano, alm do portugus, lngua nativa. presidente do Observatrio Social de Jacare (organizao sem fins lucrativos que visa o controle social e educao fiscal), co-fundador e co-coordena o frum de lean manufacturing do Vale do Paraba desde 2006 e o GT senior do CIESP de Jacare, grupo das grandes empresas da regio, desde 2013.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: Bachelor's at Engenharia Mecanica Aeronautica from Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (1986), MBA in Strategic Planning from USP (2000), master's at Systems engineering from Polytechnic School, So Paulo University (2006) and Doctor in Science at Transportation Engineering from Potytechnic School, So Paulo University (2014). He worked as an executive director in companies such as, Ericsson, Promon, Unigel group, Monsanto, Redecard and as a president at Volex do Brasil (British company in the electro-electronics business). Currently he is professor of post-graduation courses and owner of the company Teclog. He holds a CPIM certification (APICS, 2001) and speaks English, Spanish and Italian fluently. Native language: Portuguese. He is president of the Observatrio Social de Jacare (non-profit organization that aims the Social control and fiscal education), coordinates the lean manufacturing forum of the Paraiba Valley since 2006 and the GT Senior at CIESP Jacare, group of large size companies in the region, since 2013.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Certificado pela APICS em CPIM (2001), grande experincia como executivo em empresas nacionais e transnacionais de grande porte, larga vivncia internacional, tendo morado em outros pases (Inglaterra e Itlia) ou desenvolvido projetos em ambientes multiculturais (Argentina e EUA).

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Modelo matemtico e metodologia criados para otimizar redes logsticas (fornecedores, fbricas, Centros de Distribuio e mercados) de empresas multinacionais com problemas para gerenciamento de seus crditos de ICMS, do benefcio drawback e de seu fluxo de caixa.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: This work studies the impact of taxes and the influence of cycle and safety stocks on a global network design with several echelons. The proposed methodology and Mixed Integer Linear Programming model aimed to minimize the operational costs, taking into consideration the taxes involved and the chain inventory value. The approach has been implemented in four large agribusiness transnational companies with high level of credit of a State tax showing that, for this type of company, taxes are more significant than logistic cost for facility location decisions. Another conclusion is that the supply chain must be modeled with four echelons at least for problems such as the ones herein studied and that cycle stock, storage capacity and the financial cost have a high correlation with the amount of Distribution Centers. The results show also the direct impact of safety stock on the network design optimization. It is concluded that tax legislation imposes a significant increase in the logistics costs for a cash flow gain. The main contributions of this methodology are (1) the treatment of total inventory cost and (2) storage capacity, (3) the analysis of these factors and tax on companies? cash flow management and (4) the bidding approach to gather logistic costs. The math model is especially useful for agribusiness and/or exporting companies that have a high level of tax credit. The methodology has brought cash flow improvements of about US$ 22 million in one of the companies, or 5% of its total cost.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Inventory carrying cost has become very important in the analysis of the trade-offs and an important component to be considered when taking decisions about a logistic network. This paper proposes a methodology incorporated in a multi-echelon sourcing decision model, to be considered as a new version of the model presented in Hamad, Gualda (2008). It treats the carrying costs using the inventory Days-on-hand estimate in each echelon of the chain (plants and/or Distribution Centers). The main contributions of this methodology compared to other options found in the literature are the simplicity of its application, the consideration of all inventory costs (not only the ones related to the products being modeled) and, also, the inclusion of constraints related to warehousing capacity.
